snippet: The board of the Italian American Museum in the Little Italy neighborhood of Manhattan has drawn up plans to sell its building to a developer and relocate inside whatever structure replaces it.
abstract: Board of the Italian-American Museum in New York City's Little Italy neighborhood draws up plans to sell its 19th-century brick building to a developer and relocate to a larger space inside whatever replaces it; plan solves both the problem of the museum needing more space and also of not being able to afford to carry the costs of the building, even if it means tearing down a piece of history in the process.
lead_paragraph: The board of the Italian American Museum in the Little Italy neighborhood of Manhattan has drawn up plans to sell its building to a developer and relocate inside whatever structure replaces it.
